name: premiere
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the first public performance of a play or any other type of entertainment: The world premiere of the opera will be at the Metropolitan Opera House in New York.

If a show, film, etc. premieres or if it is premiered, the first public performance or showing takes place: The play was premiered in New York. The film will premiere this weekend.
More examplesFewer examplesThe choir will premiere the piece at a concert in the prison.How does it feel to premiere a movie in your hometown? When the movie premiered last winter at the Sundance Film Festival, it took home an award.

the first public showing of a play, opera, movie, television program, or other entertainment: The season premieres of two of my favorite TV shows are on Wednesday. premiere verb [ I ] us
Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio
/prɪmˈjeər, prɪˈmɪər/
The three-part BBC program will premiere in the United States on the Discovery Channel on Sunday.
